metadata.name: Shell Process Spawned by Java.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\java.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\bash.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('build')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('build'))))

output.summary: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate calls to system binaries 2. Company specific internal usage Reference: https://web.archive.org/web/20231230220738/https://www.lunasec.io/docs/blog/log4j-zero-day/
